alert.note: Alert for East Slopes Sangre de Cristo Mountains; Eastern San Miguel County; Far Northeast Highlands; Guadalupe County; Harding County; Johnson and Bartlett Mesas Including Raton Pass; Lower Rio Grande Valley; Sandia, Manzano Mountains Including Edgewood; Upper Tularosa Valley (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Wind Advisory issued December 12 at 12:02PM MST until December 12 at 11:00PM MST by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...WIND ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 PM MST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Southwest winds 25 to 35 mph with gusts up to 50 mph expected. * WHERE...Sandia and Manzano Mountains including Edgewood, East Slopes Sangre de Cristo Mountains, Lower Rio Grande Valley, Upper Tularosa Valley, Johnson and Bartlett Mesas Including Raton Pass, Far Northeast Highlands, Harding County, Eastern San Miguel County, and Guadalupe County. * WHEN...Until 11 PM MST this evening. * IMPACTS...Gusty winds will blow around unsecured objects. Tree limbs may be blown down. Expect strong crosswinds on area roadways. Blowing snow can also reduce visibilities through high mountain passes of the Sangre de Cristo Mountains. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Strong winds will continue, with the strongest winds expected this afternoon.
info.instruction: Winds this strong can make driving difficult, especially for high profile vehicles. Use extra caution. Secure outdoor objects, such as inflatable Christmas decorations.

area.areaDesc: East Slopes Sangre de Cristo Mountains; Eastern San Miguel County; Far Northeast Highlands; Guadalupe County; Harding County; Johnson and Bartlett Mesas Including Raton Pass; Lower Rio Grande Valley; Sandia, Manzano Mountains Including Edgewood; Upper Tularosa Valley
